title: A test post
text:
Read the following and see if you can answer the question:


There are three boxes in a stack. A pink one, a purple one and a green one. The pink one is in the middle of the stack with the purple below it. What is the color of the box on the bottom of the stack?

Most likely you answered purple‚Ä¶
But it is possible you first said green (don‚Äôt worry if you did it is quite a common response!)


It‚Äôs a verbal visual problem that requires some deliberation and most likely for us to create a visual image of a stack of boxes as a reasoning aid.
Notice also the complexity of the language used in the prompt to describe the scene. The use of natural language as opposed to a formal/logical calculus does hold the potential for ambiguity (multiple interpretations) and inexactness. However, it is the most normal/natural, efficient and broadly accessible way of communicating such information.
Notice 1. The use of anaphor or reference. - Three BOXES -> a pink/purple/green ONE as opposed to a pink box, a purple box and a green box. - The PINK ONE is in the middle ... the purple {BOX} below IT {the pink box}
We tend to try and avoid this kind of repetition to make our speech more coherent.

Although the description in language may not be entirely concise, there is no real ambiguity as to how the boxes can be arranged. It must be: | Box | Stack position | | ‚Äî | ‚Äî | | GREEN | top | | PINK | middle | | PURPLE | bottom |




GPT3.5 Turbo

Had some difficulties and answered green
Llama2 (chat 7B version)


Answered correctly (purple) and used some so-called chain-of-thought reasoning

Bing Chat (MS Co-pilot)
This LLM is GPT4 with some Microsoft specific tuning and RAG (search) additions.
It get‚Äôs it correct:

The color of the box on the bottom of the stack is purple. This is because the purple box is below the pink one, which is in the middle of the stack. Therefore, the purple box must be the lowest one. üü™

But when you follow up and ask it to create visual representation of the box arrangement

PROMPT: Can you create a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged?

It responds

RESPONSE: Sure, I‚Äôll try to create that. Here is a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged:

And uses DALL-E3 to create 4 different attempts at a visual representation:

NONE OF WHICH ARE CORRECT!!!

title: Drawing Pictures for ChatGPT
text:
Drawing Pictures for ChatGPT

In this blog post, I will be uploading pictures to ChatGPT.
This experiment is to see whether ChatGPT can accurately describe the scene.


1. Picture of a Switzerland Keychain

Jenn: ‚ÄúCan you describe what this photo is to me? And what this object is?‚Äù



ChatGPT: This photo shows a person wearing black gloves holding a keychain. The keychain is heart-shaped and made of wood, featuring an illustration of Interlaken, Switzerland. It has the Swiss flag on it, along with mountains and buildings, likely representing the scenic landscape of the town. The keychain is attached to a metal ring for keys.The packaging label at the top is red, displaying the brand name Alberto SA. It has a barcode and a price tag indicating Fr.¬†8.‚Äì (Swiss Francs). The background suggests a store setting, possibly a souvenir shop, with other keychains and items on display.


Jenn‚Äôs Observations: I think ChatGPT was able to accurately describe the picture!



2. Picture of ‚ÄòBabel‚Äô at Tate Modern in London

Jenn: ‚ÄúCan you tell me who made this, what it is, where it‚Äôs located, and why it was created?‚Äù



ChatGPT: Yes! This is a well-known art installation called Babel by the artist Cildo Meireles. What is it?: Babel is a towering installation made from hundreds of stacked radios from different time periods and styles. The radios are arranged in a cylindrical structure, with some turned on and emitting faint sounds, creating a layered auditory experience. Where is it located?: It is part of the collection at the Tate Modern in London, though it may be exhibited elsewhere in temporary installations. Why was it created?: Cildo Meireles created Babel as a commentary on communication, information overload, and miscommunication in the modern world. The name refers to the Biblical Tower of Babel, a story in which human ambition to reach the heavens led to the confusion of languages, causing people to be unable to understand each other. Similarly, the installation suggests the overwhelming and often chaotic nature of mass communication today. If you saw this in a different museum, it could be on loan or part of a traveling exhibition!


Jenn‚Äôs Observations: It‚Äôs interesting how ChatGPT was still able to detect that it was Babel, even though there was a person who was in the way of the art piece. I liked how it mentions that if I saw it at a different museum that it was probably apart of a traveling exhibition.



3. Picture of one side of the Sagrada Familia

Jenn: ‚ÄúWhat is this, where is this, who created it, and why was it created?‚Äù



ChatGPT: This is a photo of the interior of the Sagrada Fam√≠lia, a world-famous basilica located in Barcelona, Spain. What is this? The image captures the breathtaking stained glass windows and organic, tree-like columns inside the Sagrada Fam√≠lia. The interplay of natural light and vibrant colors is a hallmark of this architectural masterpiece. Who created it? The Sagrada Fam√≠lia was designed by the renowned Catalan architect Antoni Gaud√≠. Construction began in 1882, and it remains unfinished to this day, with ongoing work continuing in accordance with Gaud√≠‚Äôs vision. Why was it created? Gaud√≠ envisioned the Sagrada Fam√≠lia as a deeply spiritual and symbolic structure, blending Gothic and Art Nouveau styles with naturalistic forms. The basilica was created as a place of worship and devotion, meant to inspire awe and reflect Christian faith through architecture. The organic, tree-like columns, geometric details, and stained glass windows were all meticulously designed to create a harmonious and immersive experience. It is one of the most visited landmarks in the world and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, drawing millions of visitors annually. The goal is to complete its construction by 2032, marking the 150th anniversary of Gaud√≠‚Äôs death.


Jenn‚Äôs Observations: Even though I only showed a small portion, ChatGPT was still able to guess the location accurately. I am impressed.
